Description:
Cabanel enjoyed a rapid rise to fame, winning a first-class medal and being appointed a Chevalier of the Legion of Honor in 1855. He also became a professor of painting at the École des Beaux-Arts in 1863. This painting replicates a once-lost official portrait commissioned in 1865 for the apartments of Empress Eugénie in the Tuileries Palace. Scoffing critics of Napoleon III's regime dismissed the original work as "a portrait of a hotel manager." 

In 2009, the full-length portrait was rediscovered in storage at the chateau of Compiegne.
Dimensions: H: 16 1/8 x W: 12 5/8 in. (41 x 32 cm); Framed H with buildup: 22 15/16 x W: 17 1/2 x D: 5 in. (58.26 x 44.45 x 12.7 cm); Framed H without buildup: 23 x W: 17 1/2 x D: 3 1/4 in. (58.42 x 44.45 x 8.26 cm)

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: Alexandre Cabanel, la tradition du beau
Exhibitions.Textblock: Alexandre Cabanel, la tradition du beau. Musee Fabre, Montpellier; Wallraf-Richartz-Museum, Köln. 2010-2011.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: A Magnificent Age: Masterpieces from the Walters Art Museum, Baltimore
Exhibitions.Textblock: A Magnificent Age: Masterpieces from the Walters Art Museum, Baltimore. The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; The Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art, Kansas City; Mint Museum of Art, Charlotte. 2002-2004.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: The Second Empire 1852-1870: Art in France under Napoleon III
Exhibitions.Textblock: The Second Empire 1852-1870: Art in France under Napoleon III. Galeries nationales du Grand Palais, Paris; Philadelphia Museum of Art, Philadelphia; The Detroit Institute of Arts, Detroit. 1978-1979.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: Before Monet: Landscape Painting in France and Impressionist Masters: Highlights from The Walters Collection
Exhibitions.Textblock: Before Monet: Landscape Painting in France and Impressionist Masters: Highlights from The Walters Collection. The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1998.

Inscriptions: [Signature] In lower left in black cursive lettering: Ale Cabanel; [Signature] In lower right in brown block letters: Al. Cabanel
Medium: oil on red painted hardwood panel
Provenance: William T. Walters, Baltimore, 1887-1893 (?), by purchase [perhaps the Cabanel "sketch" purchased by G. A. Lucas at Chevalier's,  May 27-28, 1889]; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1894, by inheritance; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: Napoleon III
